Second scenario - if the card holder raises a dispute under ‘Goods or services not received’ (Assuming, he did not participate in the purchase), we must prove the case with supporting documents like Purchase invoice/Exchange policy, Customer communication (If any) and Mainly the Delivery documentation with the card holder signature on it. 

 

In most cases the card holder is not the one who receives the package (Could be his family or friends or he is paying for a friend). In this scenario, we are more likely to lose the case as there is no card holder signature and the schemes will declare that the package was not delivered to the actual card holder. However, the final decision stays with the schemes (Visa, Master, Amex).

 

Based on the above fraud situation which may occur again with any brand, we would like to know if brands under our legal entities are covered under credit/debit card fraud.
